Package com.app.talk

Class Sender

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.app.talk.Sender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class Sender
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    A simple sender of network traffic.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.net.Socket client
      A dummy Socket that represents the receiving Socket of the other Host.
      private java.io.DataOutputStream outputStream
      A DataOutputStream containing the OutputStream of the client Socket.
      private int port
      The port which the addressed host listens to.
      private java.lang.String remoteHost
      The ip-address of the other Host.
      private java.util.Scanner scanner
      A scanner to receive User keyboard input
      private java.lang.String userName
      The username of the sending host.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Sender​(java.lang.String remoteHost, int port, java.lang.String userName)
      A sender of information over the network.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private void closeConnection()
      Closes the client Socket as well as its OutputStream.
      private void connect()
      A method that creates a dummy Socket as a receiving end for outgoing communication.
      private void establishConnection()
      A method to establish the connection to another host over the network.
      private void reconnect()
      A method that tries to reconnect after 10 seconds
      void run()
      The the executing method of the class.
      private void sendMsg​(java.lang.String msg)
      A method that receives a String message and writes it in sequences of bytes to the other host.
      private void sendUserInput()
      A method that creates a loop in which the user keyboard input is being taken in and sent to the other Host.
      private void sendUserName()
      A method to send the username of the sending Host.
      private void setOutputStream()
      Initializes the outputStream of the Sender object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • remoteHost

        private java.lang.String remoteHost
        The ip-address of the other Host.

      • port

        private int port
        The port which the addressed host listens to.

      • client

        private java.net.Socket client
        A dummy Socket that represents the receiving Socket of the other Host. Contains the ip-address and listening port of the other Host.

      • outputStream

        private java.io.DataOutputStream outputStream
        A DataOutputStream containing the OutputStream of the client Socket.

      • userName

        private java.lang.String userName
        The username of the sending host.

      • scanner

        private java.util.Scanner scanner
        A scanner to receive User keyboard input

      • Sender

        Sender​(java.lang.String remoteHost,
       int port,
       java.lang.String userName)
        A sender of information over the network.
        Parameters:
        remoteHost - - remote machine to talk to.
        port - - remote port to talk to.
        userName - - username of this host.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        The the executing method of the class. This method is being called by the start()-method of a Thread object containing a Sender object to establish the outgoing connection to the other host.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

              throws java.io.IOException
        A method that creates a dummy Socket as a receiving end for outgoing communication.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - IOExceptions

      • reconnect

        private void reconnect()
        A method that tries to reconnect after 10 seconds

        private void setOutputStream()
        Initializes the outputStream of the Sender object

        private void sendUserInput()

        A method that receives a String message and writes it in sequences of bytes to the other host.
